data.title: Great fresh bagels, delicious sandwiches
data.text: Easy to find, quick service, the sándwiches were really good and reasonably priced. Would definitely go again.

data.title: Over decades, has never disappointed.
data.text:
Ami's bagels is a much beloved Sunday morning tradition in my family. They have many varieties, including an 'everything' bagel made with whole wheat. While there, you also MUST buy their homemade cream cheese - you will never be able to tolerate Philadelphia or any commercial brand again!  

The store itself is primarily made for take-out, though they do have some stools at a counter for on-site enjoyment.

One of our favorite ways of eating them is to toast a half, then spread it with their cream cheese and put a slice of tomato on top (and maybe a little pinch of salt). Even though we've had it for years, every time is like the first time all over again!

data.title: best bagel anywhere
data.text: Blueberry is my favorite but get there early if you want your favorite they sell out fast they are worth the wait

data.title: Always a planned stop!
data.text: Absolutely delicious bagels and creamcheese! Best in Connecticut! Soft, crispy on the outside and soft in the inside! So much variety and staff is always nice. I have never been there without a line, which proves it's popularity. The line always goes quick and absolutely worth the short wait.

data.title: Best Bagels in Waterbury
data.text: I lived in New York City for a number of years so I fancy myself as a bagel aficionado.  In Connecticut I have found it very difficult to find a great bagel.  Ami's is the best.  Sizable, crusty on the outside, chewy on the inside, this is the real deal.  A very small storefront you would not think this is the place to find great bagels, but it is worth a side trip.
